parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.05</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Terminates the effect in the given layer by fading it out according to the given duration. If named layer used and it doesn't exist, it will be allocated.for title layer see [[titleFadeOut]].<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3</title><part><name index="1"/><value>For greater efficiency and ease of modability it is recommended to use named layers available with alternative syntax since Arma 3 v1.57.134673</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> layer '''cutFadeOut''' duration</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> layer: [[Number]]</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> duration: [[Number]]</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> layerName '''cutFadeOut''' duration  &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(''Since Arma 3 v1.57.134673'')</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> layerName: [[String]] - effect layer name. Layer names are CaSe SeNsItIvE</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> duration: [[Number]] - fade out time</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Number]] - number of the corresponding layer </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>0 [[cutFadeOut]] 2;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_layer = "layer1" [[cutFadeOut]] 2;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[allCutLayers]], [[cutText]], [[cutRsc]], [[cutObj]], [[allActiveTitleEffects]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 9, 2016 - 11:30 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Krzmbrzl00|Krzmbrzl00]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
(ArmA v1.60)<br>
The actual fadeout-duration can be dependent on the duration for the fadein (e.g. specified by [[cutText]]). If the fadein-duration is set to a value less than 1 the fadeout-duration will be the given number multiplied by the fadein-duration.<br>
<ext><name>pre</name><attr/><inner>"test" cutText ["", "BLACK", 0.5, true]; // fadein is < 0

"test" cutFadeout 2; // The actual fadeout-time is 2 * 0.5 = 1
</inner><close></pre></close></ext>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
